meanings.sent1: The erosiveness of the river's current slowly shaped the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The erosiveness of the acid rain caused damage to the statue over time.
meanings.sent3: The erosiveness of the wind made the scarecrow lose its hat.
meanings.sent4: The erosiveness of time can be seen in the worn steps of the old castle.
meanings.sent5: The erosiveness of the waves against the cliffs created a stunning coastline.

meanings.definition: The ability to erode or wear away.
meanings.sent1: The erosiveness of the waves smoothed the rocks on the shore.
meanings.sent2: The erosiveness of the glacier carved deep valleys in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The erosiveness of the puppy's playful bites wore down the chew toy.
meanings.sent4: The erosiveness of the waterfall sculpted the rocks into unique shapes.
meanings.sent5: The erosiveness of the sandpaper gradually removed the old paint.

meanings.sent1: The erosiveness of the heavy rainfall washed away the topsoil.
meanings.sent2: The erosiveness of the strong winds eroded the sand dunes.
meanings.sent3: The erosiveness of the children running on the grass created muddy patches.
meanings.sent4: The erosiveness of the river's flow reshaped the riverbank.
meanings.sent5: The erosiveness of the constant foot traffic wore down the path.
